column4: Hi.  I run out of free HD space in my main partition.  This is weird.  /tmp and /home use other partitions.  How can I find why I run out of space?
graphically applications -> accessories -> disk space analyzer
sorry, then i would suggest du -h --max-depth=1
then you can traverse down the folders that are the culprits
you may want to do it as root though
psywiped Huufarted: 5.7G /var, 7.6G /usr .  Should I empty /var?  How?
your apt cache could be taking up alot of space
you can run sudo apt-get clean
hmm then something else is it up,  change your du command to /var  instead of /
and work your way down to determine what sub directory is the culprit
I see the problem now: /var/backup and /var/backups.  I was using sbackup for trying to back up my system, unsuccessfully
ahh, then delete what you need to :-)
I will just delete those directories
upgrades can be troublesome sometimes, but mostly, 8.04 -> 8.10 is painless
